DataElement.preferredDefinition: An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b)).:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._The total quantity or strength of a substance (drug or radiation) administered at one time. (NCI)_Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b)).:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._The total quantity or strength of a substance (drug or radiation) administered at one time. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b)).:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Concepts.definition: Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

Property.preferredDefinition: The total quantity or strength of a substance (drug or radiation) administered at one time. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/20/11 BCRv1.0 CDE Released - reused by CTOM; BCR content retired.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
